name: Beluganos
description: Beluganos is a new network OS designed for white-box switches (OF-DPA), which can apply large-scale networks.

name: Cumulus Linux
description: Cumulus Linux is a powerful open network operating system that allows you to automate, customize and scale using web-scale principles like the world's largest data centers.

name: FlexSwitch
description: The first open source network protocol suite offering complete layer2/layer3 functionality for accelerating development and deployment of whitebox networking gear

name: Mion
description: A switch OS based on ONLP API and Yocto project.

name: OcNOS
description: Extensive switching and routing protocol support with advanced capabilities such as MPLS and SDN

name: Open Network Linux, ONL
description: A Linux distribution for "bare metal" switches, that is, network forwarding devices built from commodity components.

name: OpenSwitch
description: A linux network operating system from Dell EMC.

name: OpenWrt
description: Is a Linux Operating System targeting embedded devices.

name: PicOS
description: A SDN OS for white box switches Layer-2/3 feature set with support for OpenFlow, OVSDB, and other protocols.

name: SONiC
description: Software for Open Networking in the Cloud SONiC

name: Stratum
description: An open source, silicon-independent switch operating system for software-defined networks

name: ONIE
description: ONIE enables a bare metal network switch ecosystem where end users have a choice among different network operating systems.

name: BESS
description: Berkeley Extensible Software Switch, BESS is a modular framework for software switches.

name: bmv2-  A P4 software switch which is usually used as a tool to verify the funtions the developers describe in P4 language.
CPqD- An OpenFlow 1.3 compatible user-space software switch implementation
FD.IO
description: Relentlessly focused on data IO speed and efficiency for more flexible and scalable networks and storage

name: Indigo
description: Indigo is an open source project aimed at enabling support for OpenFlow on physical and hypervisor switches.

name: Lagopus
description: A high-performance software OpenFlow 1.3 switch.

name: LINC-Switch
description: A pure OpenFlow software switch written in Erlang

name: Open vSwitch
description: Open vSwitch is a production quality, multilayer virtual switch.

name: PISCES
description: A Programmable, Protocol-Independent Software Switch.

name: snabbswitch
description: An open source virtualized Ethernet networking stack.

name: ZeroTier
description: ZeroTier is a software-based managed Ethernet switch for planet Earth.

name: FlowVisor
description: An OpenFlow controller that acts as a hypervisor/proxy between a switch and multiple controllers. Can slice multiple switches in parallel, effectively slicing a network.

name: OpenVirtex
description: A network hypervisor that can create multiple virtual and programmable networks on top of a single physical infrastructure.

name: OpenFlow
description: A communications protocol that gives access to the forwarding plane of a network switch or router over the network.

name: OF-Config
description: OpenFlow Management and Configuration Protocol

name: OVSDB
description: A communication protocol which used to manage the OpenvSwitch database.

name: Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol, XMPP
gNMI
description: gRPC Network Management Interface

name: gNOI
description: gRPC Network Operations Interface

name: Beehive Network Controller
description: A distributed SDN controller built on top of Beehive. It supports OpenFlow but can be easily extended for other southbound protocols.

name: Floodlight
description: A java-based OpenFlow controller.

name: IRIS
description: A Resursive SDN Openflow Controller created by SDN Research Section, ETRI.

name: lighty.io core
description: lighty.io core components - An open source development framework for building Java-based SDN controllers.

name: Netrack
description: An OpenFlow controller framework in Go.

name: NodeFlow
description: An OpenFlow Controller Node Style.

name: NOX
description: An open source development platform for C++-based software-defined networking (SDN) control applications.

name: OESS
description: The Open Exchange Software Suite to configure and control OpenFlow Enabled switches.

name: ONOS
description: Open Network Operating System.

name: Open MUL
description: A lightweight SDN/Openflow controller written almost entirely in C from scratch.

name: Open Security Controller
description: Software-defined security orchestration solution that automates deployment of virtualized network security functions, like next-generation firewall, intrusion prevention systems and application data controllers

name: OpenContrail
description: A SDN project that utilizes SDN & NFV and provides all the necessary components for network virtualization.

name: OpenDaylight
description: OpenDaylight Platform

name: OVN
description: OVN: Open Virtual Network for Open vSwitch

name: POX
description: An open source development platform for Python-based software-defined networking (SDN) control applications.

name: Ravel
description: A software-defined networking (SDN) controller that uses a standard SQL database to represent the network.

name: Ryu
description: A component-based software defined networking framework.

name: Trema
description: A full-stack, easy-to-use framework for developing OpenFlow controllers in Ruby and C.

name: Vyatta
description: The first commercial Controller built directly from OpenDaylight.

name: Containernet
description: Mininet fork that allows to use Docker containers as hosts in emulated networks

name: EstiNet
description: A world-renowned software tool for network planning

name: MaxiNet
description: MaxiNet extends the famous Mininet emulation environment to span the emulation across several physical machines. This allows to emulate very large software-defined networks.

name: Mininet
description: An Instant Virtual Network on your Laptop (or other PC)

name: ns-3
description: A discrete-event network simulator that supports OpenFlow environment.

name: OpenNet
description: A simulator for software-defined wireless local area network

name: Tinynet
description: A lightweight instant virtual network for rapid prototyping SDN

name: Frenetic
description: The Frenetic Programming Language and Runtime System

name: NEMO
description: A domain specific language (DSL) based on abstraction of network models and conclusion of operation patterns.

name: P4
description: A declarative language for expressing how packets are processed by the pipeline of a network forwarding element such as a switch, NIC, router or network function appliance.

name: POF
description: Protocol Oblivious Forwarding

name: Pyretic
description: Pyretic is one member of the Frenetic family of SDN programming languages.

name: loxigen
description: LoxiGen is a tool that generates OpenFlow protocol libraries for a number of languages.

name: nettle
description: A Haskell library for working with the OpenFlow protocol.

name: OCaml OpenFlow
description: A serialization and protocol library for OpenFlow.

name: oflib-node
description: Oflib-node is an OpenFlow protocol library for Node. It converts between OpenFlow wire protocol messages and Javascript objects.

name: openfaucet
description: openfaucet is a pure Python implementation of the OpenFlow 1.0.0 protocol, based on Twisted.

name: OpenFlowJ
description: A Java implementation of low-level OpenFlow packet marshalling/unmarshalling and IO operations.

name: Scapy
description: Scapy is a powerful interactive packet manipulation program.

name: Cbenech
description: Benchmarking tool for controllers

name: nice-of
description: A tool to test OpenFlow controller application for the NOX controller platform.

name: oftest
description: OpenFlow Testing Framework

name: OpenSDNCore
description: Virtualisation Testbed for NFV/SDN Environment.

name: ptf
description: A python based dataplane test framework based on unittest.

name: STS
description: SDN Troubleshooting System, simulates network devices, allowing programmatically test cases generation.

name: OPNFV
description: Accelerating NFV's evolution through an integrated, open platform.

name: GENEVE
description: What is GENEVE?

name: NVGRE
description: NVGRE-Network-Virtualization-using-Generic-Routing-Encapsulation

name: VXLAN
description: Virtual Extensible LAN

name: bgp4r
description: BGP4R is a ruby library which enables the creation and manipulation of BGP messages. In BGP4R, all well-known BGP constructs are defined in classes.

name: Bird
description: The BIRD project aims to develop a fully functional dynamic IP routing daemon primarily targeted on (but not limited to) Linux, FreeBSD and other UNIX-like systems and distributed under the GNU General Public License.

name: FreeRouter
description: Java-based vRouter

name: FRRouting
description: An IP routing protocol suite for Linux and Unix platforms which includes protocol daemons for BGP4, BGP4+, OSPFv2, OSPFv3, RIPv1, RIPv2, RIPng, PIM-SM/MSDP and LDP as well as very early support for IS-IS, EIGRP and NHRP.

name: gobgp
description: GoBGP is an open source BGP implementation designed from scratch for modern environment and implemented in a modern programming language, the Go Programming Language.

name: Quagga
description: Quagga is a routing software suite, providing implementations of OSPFv2, OSPFv3, RIP v1 and v2, RIPng and BGP-4 for Unix platforms, particularly FreeBSD, Linux, Solaris and NetBSD. Quagga is a fork of GNU Zebra which was developed by Kunihiro Ishiguro.

name: yabgp
description: YABGP is a yet another Python implementation for BGP Protocol. It can be used to establish BGP connections with all kinds of routers (include real Cisco/HuaWei/Juniper routers and some router simulators like GNS3) and receive/parse BGP messages for future analysis.

name: Aether Project
description: the first open source Enterprise 5G/LTE Edge-Cloud-as-a-Service platform (ECaaS).

name: Central Office Re-architected as a Datacenter, CORD
description: Reference Implementation of a Service Delivery Platform that Provides Cloud Economies and Agility.

name: Mininet Spear Narmox
description: A online web service provides a visualization of Mininet Topology

name: Open Network Automation Platform, ONAP
description: Alignment of the two projects creates a harmonized and comprehensive framework for real-time, policy-driven software automation of virtual network functions that will enable software, network, IT and cloud providers and developers to rapidly create new services.

name: ASAP2
description: The ASAP2 accelerator is built on top of eSwitch NIC hardware, and allows either the entire virtual switch, or significant portions of virtual switch or distributed virtual router (DVR) operations to be offloaded to the Mellanox NIC

name: DPDK
description: DPDK is a set of libraries and drivers for fast packet processing.

name: RDMA
description: Remote direct memory access (RDMA) is a direct memory access from the memory of one computer into that of another without involving either one's operating system. This permits high-throughput, low-latency networking

name: XDP
description: XDP or eXpress Data Path provides a high performance, programmable network data path in the Linux kernel as part of the IO Visor Project.

name: drv-netif-dpdk
description: drv-netif-dpdk is a DPDK network interface for rump kernels. The combined result is a userspace TCP/IP stack doing packet I/O via DPDK.

name: f-stack
description: F-Stack is an user space network development kit with high performance based on DPDK, FreeBSD TCP/IP stack and coroutine API.

name: mTCP
description: mTCP is a highly scalable user-level TCP stack for multicore systems. mTCP source code is distributed under the Modified BSD License. For more detail, please refer to the LICENSE. The license term of io_engine driver and ported applications may differ from the mTCP’s.

name: net-next-nuse
description: Network Stack in Userspace (NUSE) NUSE allows us to use Linux network stack as a library which any applications can directory use by linking the library. Each application has its own network stack so, it provides an instant virtualized environment apart from a host operating system.

name: nff-go
description: NFF-Go becomes part of DPDK project umbrella under Linux Foundation! Mirror repo can be found here: http://dpdk.org/browse/apps/nff-go/. We will accept patches through DPDK mail-list and standard DPDK contribution process too.

name: Apache Spot
description: Community-driven cybersecurity project, built from the ground up, to bring advanced analytics to all IT Telemetry data on an open, scalable platform

name: PNDA
description: The scalable, open source big data analytics platform for networks and services.

name: SNAS
description: Streaming Network Analytics System (project SNAS) is a framework to collect, track and access tens of millions of routing objects (routers, peers, prefixes) in real time.

name: Network Algorithmics：An Interdisciplinary Approach to Designing Fast Networked Devices
Network Programmability and Automation Skills for the Next-Generation Network Engineer
SDN: Software Defined Networks: An Authoritative Review of Network Programmability Technologies
SDN网络指南(OpenSource Book in Chinese by Pengfei Ni)
SDN核心技术剖析和实战指南
深度解析SDN: 利益、战略、技术、实践

A Survey on the Security of Stateful SDN Data Planes

Re-architecting datacenter networks and stacks for low latency and high performance
